data.enText: steadier
steadiest
developing, growing, etc. gradually and in an even and regular way
data.chText: （发展、增长等）稳步的，持续的，匀速的

data.enText: five years of steady economic growth
a steady decline in numbers
We are making slow but steady progress.
data.chText: 我们虽然缓慢但是在稳步前进。

data.enText: The castle receives a steady stream of visitors.
data.chText: 前来参观城堡的游客流量保持稳定。

data.enText: not changing and not interrupted
His breathing was steady.
a steady job/income
She drove at a steady 50 mph.
data.chText: 她以每小时50英里的稳定速度驾驶。

data.enText: They set off at a steady pace.
data.chText: 他们以不紧不慢的速度出发了。

data.enText: a steady boyfriend/girlfriend (= with whom you have a serious relationship or one that has lasted a long time)
data.chText: 关系稳定的男朋友 / 女朋友

data.enText: to have a steady relationship
firmly fixed, supported or balanced; not shaking or likely to fall down
He held the boat steady as she got in.
data.chText: 他把船稳住，让她上了船。

data.enText: I met his steady gaze.
Such fine work requires a good eye and a steady hand .
data.chText: 做这样精细的工作，眼要尖，手要稳。

data.enText: sensible; who can be relied on
The company's exports have been increasing steadily.
data.chText: 公司的出口量一直稳步增长。

data.enText: The situation got steadily worse.
He looked at her steadily.
The rain fell steadily.
(as) steady as a rock
extremely steady and calm; that you can rely on
data.chText: 十分可靠；稳如泰山；安如盘石

data.enText: ready, steady, go!
(get) ready, (get) set, go
what you say to tell people to start a race
steadies
steadying
steadied
steadied
to stop yourself/sb/sth from moving, shaking or falling; to stop moving, shaking or falling
She steadied herself against the wall.
The lift rocked slightly, steadied, and the doors opened.
data.chText: 电梯微微一晃又稳了下来，接着门开了。

data.enText: to stop changing and become regular again
Her heartbeat steadied.
The pound steadied against the dollar.
data.chText: 英镑对美元的汇率稳定下来。

data.enText: to make sb/sth calm
He took a few deep breaths to steady his nerves .
data.chText: 他深深地吸了几口气，让自己平静下来。

data.enText: in a way that is steady and does not change or shake
In trading today the dollar held steady against the yen.
data.chText: 在今天的交易中，美元对日元的汇率保持稳定。

data.enText: go steady (with sb)
to have a romantic or sexual relationship with sb, in which you see the other person regularly
used to tell sb to be careful about what they are saying or doing, for example because it is extreme or not appropriate
data.chText: （要求对方注意言行）哎，注意点

data.enText: Steady on! You can't say things like that about somebody you've never met.
data.chText: 注意点！你从没见过的人，不要这样议论人家。

data.enText: used to tell sb to be careful
data.chText: （提醒对方小心）注意，当心，小心

data.enText: Steady! Don't fall off.

means: (发展、增长等)稳步的，持续的，匀速的
(要求对方注意言行)哎，注意点
(提醒对方小心)注意，当心，小心

data.enText: (as) steady as a rock
extremely steady and calm; that you can rely on
data.chText: 十分可靠；稳如泰山；安如盘石

data.enText: ready, steady, go!
(get) ready, (get) set, go
what you say to tell people to start a race
go steady (with sb)
to have a romantic or sexual relationship with sb, in which you see the other person regularly

tr: a person loved by another person
support or hold steady and make steadfast, with or as if with a brace
example: brace your elbows while working on the potter's wheel

tr: relating to a person who does something regularly
marked by firm determination or resolution
not liable to fluctuate or especially to fall
not subject to change or variation especially in behavior

example.ex: Despite the steady progress of building work, the campaign against it is still going strong...
example.tran: 尽管建筑施工已在稳步进行，但反对活动仍然高涨。

example.ex: The improvement in standards has been steady and persistent, but has attracted little comment from educationalists...
example.tran: 标准一直在持续提高，但却几乎没有教育学家对此发表意见。

example.ex: Despite the steady rain, the mood was friendly and festive...
example.tran: 尽管一直在下雨，气氛却相当友好欢快。

example.ex: A student doesn't have a steady income.
example.tran: 学生没有稳定的收入。

value.def: A steady situation continues or develops gradually without any interruptions and is not likely to change quickly.

example.ex: Relax as much as possible and keep breathing steadily...
example.tran: 尽量放松，保持平稳呼吸。

example.ex: The company has steadily been losing market share to Boeing and Airbus.
example.tran: 该公司的市场份额持续不断地被波音公司和空中客车公司抢走。

example.ex: Get as close to the subject as you can and hold the camera steady...
example.tran: 尽量靠近拍摄对象，拿稳相机。

example.ex: It takes a very steady hand and plenty of practice to paint a perfect line.
example.tran: 只有手不发抖并多加练习才能画出完美的线条。

value.def: If an object is steady, it is firm and does not shake or move about.
value.tran: 稳定的;牢固的;不摇晃的

example.ex: 'Well, go on,' said Camilla, her voice fairly steady...
example.tran: “好吧，请继续，”卡米拉用很沉着的语气说道。

example.ex: Gail was silent for a moment, regarding Harry with his steady gaze.
example.tran: 盖尔镇定地注视着哈里，沉默了片刻。

value.def: If you look at someone or speak to them in a steady way, you look or speak in a calm, controlled way.

example.ex: He moved back a little and stared steadily at Elaine.
example.tran: 他往后退了退，冷静地看着伊莱恩。

example.ex: He was firm and steady unlike other men she knew.
example.tran: 他坚定可靠，和她认识的其他男人不一样。

example.ex: ...a politician who's steady almost to the point of being boring.
example.tran: 理智得近乎乏味的政治家

value.def: If you describe a person as steady, you mean that they are sensible and reliable.

example.ex: Two men were on the bridge-deck, steadying a ladder...
example.tran: 两名男子在船桥甲板上扶着一架梯子不让它摇晃。

example.ex: Lovelock eased back the throttles and the ship steadied.
example.tran: 洛夫洛克慢慢地拉杆减速，船稳了下来。

value.def: If you steady something or if it steadies, it stops shaking or moving about.

example.ex: Somehow she steadied herself and murmured, 'Have you got a cigarette?'...
example.tran: 她设法让自己镇定下来，并小声问：“你有烟吗?”

example.ex: She breathed in to steady her voice.
example.tran: 她吸了一口气，好使自己的声音平静下来。

value.def: If you steady yourself, you control your voice or expression, so that people will think that you are calm and not nervous.

example.ex: 'What if there's another murder?' — 'Steady on!'...
example.tran: “万一又有人被杀呢?”——“说话注意点！”

example.ex: 'One can't live with a man like that!' — 'Steady on,' said Chris.
example.tran: “和那样的男人没法过日子！”——“冷静点，”克里斯说。

value.def: You say 'steady on' to someone to tell them to calm down or to be careful about what they are saying.

example.ex: She's been going steady with Randolph for almost a year now.
example.tran: 她和伦道夫已经谈了近一年恋爱了。

gramarinfo.label: V inflects, pl-n PHR, PHR <l>with</l> n

value.def: If two people are going steady, they are having a long, fairly serious romantic relationship.
value.tran: 有确定的情侣关系;恋爱关系稳定

partsOfSpeech.d: 感到（或显得）快乐的，高兴的

partsOfSpeech.dec: in- 在内,进入,使 + jur 发誓,法律 + -y ...的
sym- 共同,相同 + phon 声音 + -y ...的
